links.title: CSS: Using brightness() to highlight content
links.description: Rick Strahl explains how to use the `brightness()` filter in CSS to generically highlight content, like links or buttons.

links.title: How Fathom handled 10 million users
links.description: Jack Ellis talks about how Fathom, the Google Analytics alternative, handled a traffic spike with millions of users.

links.title: Dialects in Code
links.description: Dialects describe on how the same programming language is used in radically different ways by different people.

links.title: Flexboxdefense
links.description: Learn the CSS flexbox feature by playing tower defense using flexbox to position your turrets.

links.title: Unix Timestamp 1600000000
links.description: Did you know that we recently hit the 1600000000th unix timestamp milestone?

links.title: Read me
links.description: An excellent guide by Readymag to improve readability of articles and written web content.

links.title: The AVIF image format
links.description: Do you know the AVIF image format? You should. It cut image sizes in half, compared to JPEG and WebP.

links.title: Scrollbar Blindness
links.description: If developers mostly use macOS, this can be a serious problem for users: when scrollbar-blindness kicks in.

links.title: Civilization VI UI in the browser
links.description: Sarkis rebuilt the Civilization VI UI in the browser, using only the no-code tool Webflow.
